column4: I plug in my x-box controller; the xpad module loads, but it controls my mouse cursor and isn't identified as a joystick. How do I get it to recognize it as a joystick instead?
there should be an app in the config app someplace where you can config it
which app is that? ie what should I run to find that
if it isnt installed run: sudo apt-get install jscalibrator
right I've checked that before; it sees my js0 as the xbox controller, but it doesn't register any input. Moving my axis just moves my mouse cursor
trying that; the codes not compiling but I'm trying to fudge it a little
I think this may be the answer: the driver is fine, it's X that's grabbing my input: http://www.gs1.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=6267529&posted=1#post6267529
Okay this was the answer: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Joystick_lshal_outputs_done  thanks for your help
you dont mount drives, you mount partitions ;)
if you add the partition in /etc/fstab the options you set will be used when it is mounted
it's a USB drive so the /dev/ name of it changes sometimes.. can I set it to recognize the volume name/something similar instead?
if you run: sudo blkid   you can get the UUID which never changes
